metadata.title: CVE-2021-3752 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A use-after-free flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s Bluetooth subsystemin the way user calls connect to the socket and disconnect simultaneouslydue to a race condition. This flaw allows a user to crash the system orescalate their privileges. The highest threat from this vulnerability is toconfidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
